contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Croaking Cisticola | status = LC | status_system = IUCN3.1 | status_ref = <ref>{{IUCN|id=106007343 |title=''Cisticola natalensis'' | assessors=[[BirdLife International]] |version=2012.1 |year=2012 |accessdate=16 July 2012}}</ref> | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[bird|Aves]] | ordo = [[Passeriformes]] | familia = [[Cisticolidae]] | genus = ''[[Cisticola]]'' | species = '''''C. natalensis''''' | binomial = ''Cisticola natalensis'' | binomial_authority = ([[Andrew Smith (zoologist)|Smith]], 1843) }} The '''Croaking Cisticola''' (''Cisticola natalensis'') is an [[Old World warbler]] in the genus ''[[Cisticola]]''. This genus is sometimes split off with various other southern warbler genera and given family status as the Cisticolidae. The Croaking Cisticola is a resident breeder in [[Africa]] south of the [[Sahara]]. It is a very small insectivorous [[bird]]. These small [[passerine]]s are found in rank grassland habitats, often near swamps or water. Male cisticolas are polygamous; the female builds a discreet nest deep in the grasses, often binding living leaves into the soft fabric of [[felted]] plant-down, cobwebs, and grass. The Croaking Cisticola's nest is a ball shape with a side entrance; 2-4 eggs are laid. This is the largest cisticola. This warbler is grey-brown above, heavily streaked with black. The underparts are whitish, and the tail is broad, pale-tipped and flicked frequently. It has a chestnut wing-panel and a heavy bill. It is very similar to other members of its genus. It is best distinguished from its many African relatives by its size and froglike croaking ''breep-breep'' song. The song is always the easiest identification criterion for this genus. These birds are more easily heard than seen, and because of their small size (about 14 cm) not always easy to recognise, particularly outside the breeding season when they seldom emerge from their grasses. ==References== {{Reflist}}<!-- FieldianaZool51:91. --> * ''Birds of The Gambia'' by Barlow, Wacher and Disley, ISBN 1-873403-32-1 [[Category:Cisticolidae]] [[Category:Birds of Africa]] [[Category:Birds of Kenya]] [[Category:Birds of Cameroon]] {{cisticolidae-stub}}
